Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially pink-red in section, the exterior is covered with a red-orange slip and very faint traces of at least four lines of black-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393804) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393804)
